p: COVID-19 data from children are current sparse, but infants reportedly show more severe symptoms [ 5, 49]. Although thorough quarantine protocols can delay the spread to children, it is expected that most children will become infected with this adapted virus. The majority of patients may be asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic, but some children can be afflicted with severe pneumonia. Young children easily become carriers for long periods and acted as reservoirs during epidemics of MP pneumonia, seasonal influenza, and possibly SARS-CoV-2 infection [ 50, 51].
